content:
Please execute the following task in my repository mcpmark-eval/claude-code:

I need you to research the development history of the mcpleague-eval/claude-code repository across multiple branches and commits, then create a comprehensive feature tracking document and submit it as a new file to the repository.

**Step 1: Multi-Branch Feature Investigation**
Research and identify the exact commit SHAs where these specific features were introduced by analyzing commits across different branches:

1. **Shell Completion Scripts**: Find when shell completion functionality was first added to the repository
2. **CHANGELOG Version 1.0.65**: Find when the changelog was updated to include version 1.0.65 
3. **Rust Extraction Improvements**: Find when workflow improvements for Rust code extraction were implemented

**Step 2: Create Feature Tracking Documentation**
Create a file called `FEATURE_COMMITS.md` in the repository root with:

- A "# Feature Development Tracking" title
- A "## Overview" section explaining this tracks major feature additions across repository branches
- A "## Feature Commit History" section with this exact table format:
```markdown
| Feature Name | Commit SHA | Author | Branch | Date | Files Changed | Commit Message |
|-------------|------------|---------|---------|------|---------------|----------------|
```

For each feature, populate the table with:
- Exact commit SHA (full 40-character hash)
- GitHub username of the commit author
- Branch where the commit was made
- Commit date in YYYY-MM-DD format
- Number of files changed in that commit
- First line of the commit message

**Step 3: Commit Documentation to Repository**
Commit the `FEATURE_COMMITS.md` file to the main branch with:
- Commit message: "Add feature development tracking documentation"
- Ensure the file is properly formatted markdown
- Verify all commit SHAs in the table are accurate and verifiable

The verification process will check that your table contains the correct commit SHAs for each specific feature, along with accurate author, branch, and date information.

Note: Based on your understanding, solve the task all at once by yourself, don't ask for my opinions on anything.

content.text: I'll help you research the development history and create a comprehensive feature tracking document. Let me start by examining the repository structure and commit history across different branches.
Now let me examine the commits on each branch to find the specific features mentioned:

\":\"https://api.github.com/users/gitmpr/repos\",\"starred_url\":\"https://api.github.com/users/gitmpr/starred{/owner}{/repo}\",\"subscriptions_url\":\"https://api.github.com/users/gitmpr/subscriptions\"},\"parents\":[{\"sha\":\"5faa082d6e4e5300485daafb94615fe133175055\",\"html_url\":\"https://github.com/mcpmark-eval/claude-code/commit/5faa082d6e4e5300485daafb94615fe133175055\",\"url\":\"https://api.github.com/repos/mcpmark-eval/claude-code/commits/5faa082d6e4e5300485daafb94615fe133175055\"}],\"html_url\":\"https://github.com/mcpmark-eval/claude-code/commit/8a0febdd09bda32f38c351c0881784460d69997d\",\"url\":\"https://api.github.com/repos/mcpmark-eval/claude-code/commits/8a0febdd09bda32f38c351c0881784460d69997d\",\"comments_url\":\"https://api.github.com/repos/mcpmark-eval/claude-code/commits/8a0febdd09bda32f38c351c0881784460d69997d/comments\",\"stats\":{\"additions\":641,\"deletions\":0,\"total\":641},\"files\":[{\"sha\":\"d9f70cb845796c2b5945785276b7fd6ec0dfd491\",\"filename\":\"shell-completions/README.md\",\"additions\":81,\"deletions\":0,\"changes\":81,\"status\":\"added\",\"patch\":\"@@ -0,0 +1,81 @@\\n+# Claude Code CLI Shell Completions\\n+\\n+This directory contains tab completion scripts for the `claude` command in bash, fish, and zsh shells.\\n+\\n+## Installation\\n+\\n+### Bash Completion\\n+\\n+```bash\\n+# Copy the completion script to a completion directory\\n+sudo cp claude-completions.bash /etc/bash_completion.d/claude\\n+\\n+# Or for user-only installation:\\n+mkdir -p ~/.local/share/bash-completion/completions\\n+cp claude-completions.bash ~/.local/share/bash-completion/completions/claude\\n+\\n+# Reload bash completions\\n+source /etc/bash_completion\\n+# or restart your shell\\n+```\\n+\\n+### Fish Completion\\n+\\n+```bash\\n+# Copy to fish completions directory\\n+mkdir -p ~/.config/fish/completions\\n+cp claude-completions.fish ~/.config/fish/completions/claude.fish\\n+\\n+# Fish will automatically load the completions\\n+```\\n+\\n+### Zsh Completion\\n+\\n+```zsh\\n+# Copy to a directory in your fpath\\n+mkdir -p ~/.local/share/zsh/site-functions\\n+cp claude-completions.zsh ~/.local/share/zsh/site-functions/_claude\\n+\\n+# Add to your ~/.zshrc if not already present:\\n+fpath=(~/.local/share/zsh/site-functions $fpath)\\n+\\n+# Reload completions\\n+autoload -U compinit \\u0026\\u0026 compinit\\n+```\\n+\\n+## Features\\n+\\n+All completion scripts support:\\n+\\n+- âœ… Main command options (-d, --debug, --print, etc.)\\n+- âœ… All subcommands (config, mcp, install, etc.)\\n+- âœ… Nested subcommand options (config get/set, mcp add/remove)\\n+- âœ… File/directory completion for relevant flags (--settings, --add-dir, --mcp-config)\\n+- âœ… Choice completion for enums (--output-format, --permission-mode, --transport)\\n+- âœ… Model name suggestions for --model and --fallback-model flags\\n+- âœ… Help text and descriptions for all options\\n+\\n+## Usage Examples\\n+\\n+After installation, you can use tab completion:\\n+\\n+```bash\\n+claude \\u003cTAB\\u003e                    # Shows: config, mcp, install, etc.\\n+claude --\\u003cTAB\\u003e                  # Shows all global options\\n+claude config \\u003cTAB\\u003e             # Shows: get, set, list, add, etc.\\n+claude mcp add --\\u003cTAB\\u003e          # Shows: --scope, --transport, etc.\\n+claude --output-format \\u003cTAB\\u003e    # Shows: text, json, stream-json\\n+claude --model \\u003cTAB\\u003e            # Shows: sonnet, opus, haiku, etc.\\n+```\\n+\\n+## Testing\\n+\\n+Test the completions by typing commands and pressing Tab:\\n+\\n+- Basic command completion\\n+- Option flag completion  \\n+- Subcommand completion\\n+- Value completion for choice-based options\\n+- File/directory completion for path options\\n+\\n+The completion scripts handle complex nested command structures and provide context-aware suggestions.\",\"blob_url\":\"https://github.com/mcpmark-eval/claude-code/blob/8a0febdd09bda32f38c351c0881784460d69997d/shell-completions%2FREADME.md\",\"raw_url\":\"https://github.com/mcpmark-eval/claude-code/raw/8a0febdd09bda32f38c351c0881784460d69997d/shell-completions%2FREADME.md\",\"contents_url\":\"https://api.github.com/repos/mcpmark-eval/claude-code/contents/shell-completions%2FREADME.md?ref=8a0febdd09bda32f38c351c0881784460d69997d\"},{\"sha\":\"e38a90115b835dbb7a6a3086865d36710d73a74a\",\"filename\":\"shell-completions/claude-completions.bash\",\"additions\":256,\"deletions\":0,\"changes\":256,\"status\":\"added\",\"patch\":\"@@ -0,0 +1,256 @@\\n+#!/bin/bash\\n+\\n+_claude_completions() {\\n+    local cur prev words cword\\n+    _init_completion || return\\n+\\n+    local commands=\\\"config mcp migrate-installer setup-token doctor update install\\\"\\n+    local global_opts=\\\"-d --debug --verbose -p --print --output-format --input-format \\n+                      --mcp-debug --dangerously-skip-permissions --allowedTools --disallowedTools \\n+                      --mcp-config --append-system-prompt --permission-mode -c --continue \\n+                      -r --resume --model --fallback-model --settings --add-dir --ide \\n+                      --strict-mcp-config --session-id -v --version -h --help\\\"\\n+\\n+    # Handle subcommands\\n+    local i=1\\n+    local subcommand=\\\"\\\"\\n+    while [[ $i -lt $cword ]]; do\\n+        if [[ \\\"${words[i]}\\\" =~ ^(config|mcp|migrate-installer|setup-token|doctor|update|install)$ ]]; then\\n+            subcommand=\\\"${words[i]}\\\"\\n+
